title: Interview with Skism One - AKA Lord SSS (triple S)
historical_context: This interview provides insight into the early days of virus creation and the mindset of virus authors during the early 1990s, a time when computer viruses were becoming more prevalent and notorious.
target_audience: Hackers, virus authors, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This article features an interview with Skism One, a virus author who discusses his motivations for creating viruses, his early experiences, and the evolution of his work in the field. It highlights the culture of virus writing and the personalities involved.
summary: The conversation delves into the motivations behind virus creation, with Skism emphasizing the importance of originality and style in his work. He expresses a mix of pride and irreverence towards antivirus software creators, acknowledging their role in spreading his name while dismissing their products as inferior. Skism also touches on the camaraderie among virus writers and the competitive spirit that drives them. As he hints at future projects, the interview captures the essence of a subculture that thrives on disruption and innovation, revealing the mindset of a generation of hackers who were redefining the boundaries of technology and ethics.
